p: Insects in New Zealand, including locusts, are classified as novel food by Food Standards Australia New Zealand (FSANZ), with the exception of three species, due to lack of safety concerns. Studies have found microbial and fungal loads of fresh insects are reasonably high [ 20, 21, 22]. However, processing steps such as blanching, heat treatments, and sterilization are sufficient methods to reduce safety risks in various insect species [ 20, 22, 23].
